org.jpws.front

Class FileOpenDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JFileChooser
            • org.jpws.front.FileOpenDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class FileOpenDialog
extends javax.swing.JFileChooser
    This file open dialog is an extention of JFileChooser which incorporates several possible file filters.
    Author:
    Kevin Preece, Wolfgang Keller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileOpenDialog

        public FileOpenDialog(int filtermod)
        Creates a FileOpenDialog with an optional set of file filtering options pointing to the user's default directory.
        Parameters:
        filtermod - determines available file type filters in OR conjunction. 0 = no filter; PWSFILE_FILTER, BACKUP_FILTER, EXECUTABLE_FILTER

      • FileOpenDialog

        public FileOpenDialog(int filtermod,
                      java.io.File currentDirectory)
        Creates a FileOpenDialog with an optional set of file filtering options and a specified start directory.
        Parameters:
        filtermod - determines available file type filters in OR conjunction. 0 = no filter; PWSFILE_FILTER, BACKUP_FILTER, EXECUTABLE_FILTER
        currentDirectory - File

      • FileOpenDialog

        public FileOpenDialog(int filtermod,
                      java.lang.String currentDirectoryPath)
        Creates a FileOpenDialog with an optional set of file filtering options and a start directory.
        Parameters:
        filtermod - determines available file type filters in OR conjunction. 0 = no filter; PWSFILE_FILTER, BACKUP_FILTER, EXECUTABLE_FILTER
        currentDirectoryPath - String filepath
